message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.HC, cs.CL 

The paper deals with facial analysis in videos, which is a subfield of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel weakly supervised learning method, which involves modeling the temporal aspect in videos. This suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), which deals with developing algorithms that can learn from data. Additionally, the paper deals with analyzing facial expressions in the context of dyadic conversations, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also mentions clinical pain, which suggests that it could belong to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) or cs.CL (Computation and Language), both of which deal with analyzing human behavior and language.
